00493         // Create a socket.
00494         int listensock = socket(PF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, 0);
00495         if (listensock < 0) {
00496                 printf("Error creating socket.\n");
00497                 exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00498         }
00499 
00500         // Allow listening port to be reused if defunct.
00501         int yes = 1;
00502         status = setsockopt(listensock, SOL_SOCKET, SO_REUSEADDR, &yes, sizeof yes);
00503         if (status != 0) {
00504                 printf("Error configuring socket.\n");
00505                 exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00506         }
00507 
00508         // Bind it to the listening port.
00509         struct sockaddr_in listenaddr;
00510         memset(&listenaddr, 0, sizeof listenaddr);
00511         listenaddr.sin_family = AF_INET;
00512         listenaddr.sin_port = htons(params.server_port);
00513         inet_pton(AF_INET, params.server_host, &(listenaddr.sin_addr)); // bind to local IP address
00514         status = bind(listensock, (struct sockaddr*) &listenaddr, sizeof listenaddr);
00515         if (status != 0) {
00516                 printf("Error binding socket.\n");
00517                 exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00518         }
00519 
00520         // Listen for connections.
00521         status = listen(listensock, MAX_LISTENQUEUELEN);
00522         if (status != 0) {
00523                 printf("Error listening on socket.\n");
00524                 exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00525         }
00526 
00527         char table_name[100];   
00528         FILE* fp;
00529         int temp_counter = 0;
00530 
00531 // Listen loop.
00532         int wait_for_connections = 1;
00533         while (wait_for_connections) {
00534                 // Wait for a connection.
00535                 struct sockaddr_in clientaddr;
00536                 socklen_t clientaddrlen = sizeof clientaddr;
00537                 int clientsock = accept(listensock, (struct sockaddr*)&clientaddr, &clientaddrlen);
00538                 if (clientsock < 0) {
00539                         printf("Error accepting a connection.\n");
00540                         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00541                 }
00542                 char message3[150];
00543                 sprintf(message3, "Got a connection from %s:%d.\n", inet_ntoa(clientaddr.sin_addr), clientaddr.sin_port);
00544                 logger(serverlog, message3);
00545 
00546                 // Get commands from client.
00547                 int wait_for_commands = 1;
00548                 do {
00549                         // Read a line from the client.
00550                         char cmd[MAX_CMD_LEN];
00551                         int status = recvline(clientsock, cmd, MAX_CMD_LEN);
00552                         if (status != 0) {
00553                                 // Either an error occurred or the client closed the connection.
00554                                 wait_for_commands = 0;
00555                         } else {
00556                                 // Handle the command from the client.
00557                                  int status = handle_command(clientsock, cmd, &serverlog, &params, head);
00558                                 if (status != 0)
00559                                         wait_for_commands = 0; // Oops.  An error occured.
00560                         }
00561                 } while (wait_for_commands);
00562                 
00563                 // Close the connection with the client.
00564                 close(clientsock);
00565 
00566                 char message4[150];
00567                 sprintf(message4, "Closed connection from %s:%d.\n", inet_ntoa(clientaddr.sin_addr), clientaddr.sin_port);
00568                 logger(serverlog, message4);
00569                 
00570         }
00571         
00572         // Stop listening for connections.
00573         close(listensock);
00574         if (LOGGING == 2){
00575                         fclose(serverlog);
00576         }
00577         return EXIT_SUCCESS;
00578 }

00588 struct table *find_table(char* name, struct head* head){
00589 
00590         if(head->head == NULL) return NULL;//nothing in list
00591         struct table* probe = head->head;
00592 
00593         do{
00594                 if(!strcmp(probe->name, name)) return probe;//found match, return pointer to table
00595                 if(probe->next == NULL) return NULL;//reached end of list, exit
00596                 probe = probe->next;//traverse through list
00597 
00598         }while(1);//runs endlessly, assumes return will exit eventually (when reaching end of list)
00599         
00600         return NULL;
00601 }
00602 
00609 struct key *find_key(char* name, struct table* table){
00610 
00611         if(table->head == NULL) return NULL;//nothing in list
00612 
00613                 struct key* probe = table->head;
00614                 int i = 0;
00615 
00616                 do{
00617                         if(!strcmp(probe->name, name)) return probe;//found match, return pointer to table
00618                         if(probe->next == NULL) return NULL;//reached end of list, exit
00619                         probe = probe->next;//traverse through list
00620 
00621                 }while(i == 0);//runs endlessly, assumes return will exit eventually (when reaching end of list)
00622 
00623                 return NULL;
00624 
00625 }

00657 struct table* create_table_bare(char* name_table, struct table_info *temp){
00658 
00659         struct table* new = (struct table *) malloc(sizeof(struct table));
00660 
00661         //set values of table
00662         strcpy(new->name,name_table);
00663         new->next = NULL;
00664         new->back = NULL;
00665         new->number_records = 1;
00666         new->head = NULL;
00667         
00668         int i = 0;
00669         while(temp->name_for_column[i][0] != '\0'){
00670 
00671                 strcpy(new->col_name[i],temp->name_for_column[i]);
00672                 i++;
00673         }
00674         i = 0;
00675         while(temp->type_for_name[i][0] != '\0'){
00676 
00677                 strcpy(new->col_type[i],temp->type_for_name[i]);
00678                 i++;
00679         }
00680         return new;//return new table upon successful creation
00681 }

00704         while(temp->col_value[i][0] != '\0'){
00705                 strcpy(new->value_per_col[i],temp->col_value[i]);       
00706                 i++;
00707         }
00708         
00709         return new;
00710 }
00711 
00712 
00719 void insert_table(struct table* new_table, struct head* head){
00720 
00721         if(head ->head == NULL){
00722                 head ->head = new_table;
00723                 return;
00724         }
00725 
00726         struct table* probe = head->head;
00727 
00728         do{
00729                 if(probe->next == NULL){
00730                         probe->next = new_table;
00731                         new_table->back = probe;
00732 
00733                         return;
00734                 }
00735 
00736                 probe = probe->next;
00737 
00738         }while(1);
00739 
00740 }
00741

00750 void insert_key(struct key* new_key, struct table* table){
00751 
00752         if(table->head == NULL){
00753                         table->head = new_key;
00754                         return;
00755                 }
00756 
00757         int i = 0;
00758         struct key* probe = table->head;
00759 
00760         do{
00761                 if(probe->next == NULL){
00762                         probe->next = new_key;
00763                         new_key->back = probe;
00764 
00765                         return;
00766                 }
00767 
00768                 probe = probe->next;
00769 
00770         }while(i == 0);
00771 
00772 }

00811 
00818 void delete_key(struct key* target_key, struct table* table){
00819 
00820         if(target_key->back == NULL){
00821 
00822                 if(target_key->next == NULL){
00823                         table->head = NULL;
00824                         free(target_key);
00825                         return;
00826                 }
00827                 else if(target_key->next != NULL){
00828                         table->head = target_key->next;
00829                         table->head->back = NULL;
00830                         free(target_key);
00831                         return;
00832                 }
00833 
00834         }else if(target_key->back != NULL){
00835 
00836                 if(target_key->next == NULL){
00837                         target_key->back->next = NULL;
00838                         free(target_key);
00839                         return;
00840                 }
00841                 else if(target_key->next != NULL){
00842                         target_key->back->next = target_key->next;
00843                         target_key->next->back = target_key->back;
00844                         free(target_key);
00845                         return;
00846                 }
00847         }
00848 }

00850 
00860 int set_function(char *table_name, char *key_name ,char *value, struct head* head, struct temp_table_info* temp){
00861 
00862         if (head->head == NULL) {
00863                 errno = ERR_TABLE_NOT_FOUND;
00864                 return 2;
00865         }
00866         else {
00867                 struct table* target_table = find_table(table_name, head);
00868                 if(target_table == NULL) {
00869                         errno = ERR_TABLE_NOT_FOUND;
00870                         return 2;
00871                 }
00872                 else{
00873                         if(strcmp(value, "null")){
00874                                 if(compare_formats(temp, target_table) == -1) return 4;
00875                         }
00876                         struct key* target_key = find_key(key_name, target_table);
00877 
00878                         if(target_key == NULL){
00879 
00880                                 if(!strcmp(value,"null") || !strcmp(value,"NULL") || value == NULL){
00881                                         errno = ERR_KEY_NOT_FOUND;
00882                                         return 3;
00883                                 }
00884                                 else {
00885                                         if(target_table->number_records < MAX_RECORDS_PER_TABLE){
00886                                                 struct key* new_key = create_key(key_name, value,temp);
00887                                                 insert_key(new_key, target_table);
00888                                                 return 0;
00889                                         }
00890                                         else{
00891                                                 errno = ERR_UNKNOWN;
00892                                                 return 3;
00893                                         }
00894                                 }
00895                         }
00896                         else if(target_key != NULL){
00897 
00898                                 if(!strcmp(value,"null") || !strcmp(value,"NULL") || value == NULL){
00899 
00900                                         delete_key(target_key, target_table);
00901                                         return 0;
00902                                 }
00903                                 else{//changed from simple stcpy of value
00904                                         delete_key(target_key, target_table);
00905                                         struct key* new_key = create_key(key_name, value,temp);
00906                                         insert_key(new_key, target_table);
00907                                         return 0;
00908                                 }
00909                         }
00910 
00911                 }
00912         }
00913 
00914 return -1;
00915 
00916 }
00917 
00918 
00927 int get_function(char *table_name, char *key_name, char *value, struct head* head){
00928                 
00929         if(head->head == NULL){
00930                 errno = ERR_TABLE_NOT_FOUND;
00931                 return 2;
00932         }
00933         else{
00934 
00935                 struct table* target_table = find_table(table_name, head);
00936                 if(target_table == NULL){
00937                         errno = ERR_TABLE_NOT_FOUND;
00938                         return 2;
00939                 }
00940                 else{
00941                         struct key* target_key = find_key(key_name, target_table);
00942 
00943                         if(target_key == NULL){
00944                                 errno = ERR_KEY_NOT_FOUND;
00945                                 return 1;
00946                         }
00947                         else{
00948                                 strcpy(value, target_key->value);
00949                                 return 0;
00950                         }
00951                 }
00952 
00953         }
00954 
00955 return -1;
00956 }
00957 
00964 int compare_query_format(struct temp_table_info* temp_info, struct table* target_table) {
00965     int i = 0;
00966     while (temp_info->col_name[i][0] != '\0') {
00967         int found_match = 0;
00968         int x = 0;
00969         while ((target_table->col_name[x][0] != '\0') && !found_match) {
00970             if (!strcmp(target_table->col_name[x],temp_info->col_name[i])) found_match = 1;
00971             if(found_match){
00972 
00973                 if(!strcmp(temp_info->col_type[i],"int") && (!strcmp(target_table->col_type[x],"+int") || !strcmp(target_table->col_type[x],"-int") || !strcmp(target_table->col_type[x],"int"))){
00974 
00975                 }else if(!strcmp(temp_info->col_type[i], "char") && !strncmp(target_table->col_type[x],"char",4)){
00976 
00977                         char value[3];
00978 
00979                         value[0] = target_table->col_type[x][5];
00980                         value[1] = target_table->col_type[x][6];
00981                         value[2] = '\0';
00982 
00983                         int max_len = atoi(value);
00984                         if(strlen(temp_info->col_value[i]) > max_len) return -1;
00985 
00986                  }
00987                  else{
00988 
00989                          return -1;//found no correct matches in type (no char/int)
00990 
00991                  }
00992             }
00993 
00994             x++;
00995         }
00996         if(!found_match) return -1;
00997         i++;
00998     }
00999     return 0;
01000 }
01001 
01008 int compare_formats(struct temp_table_info* temp_info, struct table* target_table) {
01009     int i = 0;
01010     if(strlen(temp_info->col_name) != strlen(target_table->col_name)) return -1;
01011     //if(strlen(temp_info->col_type) != strlen(target_table->col_type)) return -1;
01012     while (temp_info->col_name[i][0] != '\0' ) {
01013         if (strcmp(temp_info->col_name[i], target_table->col_name[i])) return -1;
01014         if(!strcmp(temp_info->col_type[i],"int") && (!strcmp(target_table->col_type[i],"+int") || !strcmp(target_table->col_type[i],"-int") || !strcmp(target_table->col_type[i],"int"))){
01015 
01016                 if(!strcmp(target_table->col_type[i],"+int")){
01017                         if(atoi(temp_info->col_value[i]) < 0) return -1;
01018                 }
01019                 else if(!strcmp(target_table->col_type[i],"-int")){
01020                         if(atoi(temp_info->col_value[i]) > 0) return -1;
01021                 }
01022         }
01023         else if(!strcmp(temp_info->col_type[i], "char") && !strncmp(target_table->col_type[i],"char",4)){
01024 
01025                 char value[3];
01026 
01027                 value[0] = target_table->col_type[i][5];
01028                 value[1] = target_table->col_type[i][6];
01029                 value[2] = '\0';
01030                 int max_len = atoi(value);
01031 
01032                 if(strlen(temp_info->col_value[i]) > max_len) return -1;
01033 
01034         }
01035         else{
01036                 return -1;
01037         }
01038         i++;
01039     }
01040     if(temp_info->col_name[i][0] == '\0' && target_table->col_name[i][0] != '\0') return -1;
01041 
01042     return 0;
01043 
01044 }
01045 
01046 
01053 int query_parser(char* line, struct temp_table_info* temp_info) {
01054 
01055     char* split_on_comma = NULL;
01056     char col_name[300];
01057     char col_value[300];
01058     char operators;
01059     int p = 0;
01060     int i = 0;
01061     int j = 0;
01062     int counter = 0;
01063     int dotcheck = 0;
01064     int signcheck = 0;
01065 
01066     split_on_comma = strtok(line, ",");
01067     while (split_on_comma != NULL) {
01068         counter  = 0;
01069         i = 0;
01070         p = 0;
01071         int s =0;
01072         int filled_name = 0;
01073         int filled_operator = 0;
01074         int found_first_letter = 0;
01075         int found_last_letter = 0;
01076         int found_very_first_letter = 0;
01077         int save_index = 0;
01078         while(1){
01079                 if((split_on_comma[i] != '=' && split_on_comma[i] != '>' && split_on_comma[i] != '<') && !filled_name){
01080                         if(split_on_comma[i] != ' '){
01081                                 col_name[s] = split_on_comma[i];
01082                                 s++;
01083                         }
01084                         if(split_on_comma[i] == ' ' && !found_last_letter){
01085                                 save_index = i;
01086                                 found_last_letter = 1;
01087                         }
01088                         else if(!found_last_letter) save_index = i+1;
01089                 }
01090                 else if(!filled_name){
01091                         filled_name = 1;
01092                         col_name[s+1] = '\0';
01093                 }
01094                 if(filled_operator && filled_name && found_first_letter){
01095                     col_value[p] = split_on_comma[i];
01096                     p++;
01097                 }
01098                 if(filled_operator && filled_name && split_on_comma[i] != ' ' && !found_first_letter){
01099                         col_value[p] = split_on_comma[i];
01100                         p++;
01101                         found_first_letter = 1;
01102                 }
01103                 if(filled_name && !filled_operator){
01104                         operators = split_on_comma[i];
01105                         filled_operator = 1;
01106                 }
01107                 if(split_on_comma[i] == '\0') break;
01108                 i++;
01109         }
01110         if(col_name[0] == '\0') return -1;
01111         if(col_value[0] == '\0') return -1;
01112         if(operators == '\0') return -1;
01113         //sscanf(split_on_comma, "%s %c %[^'\n']",col_name, &operators, col_value);
01114         i = 0;
01115         while (col_value[i] != '\0')
01116                 {
01117                         if (isdigit(col_value[i]) == 0 ) {
01118                                 if (col_value[i] != ' ' && col_value[i] != '.' && col_value[i] != '-' && col_value[i] != '+')
01119                                 counter++;
01120                         }
01121                         if(col_value[i] == '.') dotcheck++;
01122                         if(col_value[i] == '-' || col_value[i] == '+') signcheck++;
01123                         i++;
01124                 }
01125         if (counter != 0){
01126            //If it is a character.
01127            if (operators != '=')    return -1;
01128 
01129         }else if(counter == 0 && dotcheck > 0) return -1; // found double
01130         else if (operators != '>' && operators != '<' && operators != '=') return -1;
01131         //If counter > 0, it is a character else int.
01132         if (counter != 0){
01133             strcpy(temp_info->col_type[j], "char");
01134         }else if(counter == 0 && dotcheck > 0) return -1; // found double
01135         else strcpy(temp_info->col_type[j], "int");
01136         strcpy(temp_info->col_value[j], col_value);
01137         temp_info->operators[j][0] = operators;
01138         strcpy(temp_info->col_name[j], col_name);
01139         j++;
01140         split_on_comma = strtok(NULL, ",");
01141 
01142 
01143     }
01144     return 0;
01145 }
01146 
01147 
01148 
01155 int input_parser(char* line, struct temp_table_info* temp_info)
01156 {
01157     char* split_on_comma = NULL;
01158     char firstpart[300];
01159     char secondpart[300];
01160     int i = 0;
01161     int j = 0;
01162     split_on_comma = strtok(line, ",");
01163 
01164     while (split_on_comma != NULL) {
01165         int counter = 0;
01166         sscanf(split_on_comma, "%s %[^'\n]", firstpart, secondpart);
01167         // Add the col_name into the struct
01168 
01169         int dotcheck = 0;
01170         int signcheck = 0;
01171         i = 0;
01172         while (secondpart[i] != '\0')
01173                 {
01174                         if (isdigit(secondpart[i]) == 0 ) {
01175                             if (secondpart[i] != ' ' && secondpart[i] != '.' && secondpart[i] != '-' && secondpart[i] != '+')
01176                                 counter++;
01177                         }
01178                         if(secondpart[i] == '.') dotcheck++;
01179                         if(secondpart[i] == '-' || secondpart[i] == '+') signcheck++;
01180                         i++;
01181                 }
01182         if(counter == 0){
01183                 //checks if number has spaces/weird symbols
01184                 int w = 0;
01185                 while(secondpart[w] != '\0'){
01186                         if(!isdigit(secondpart[w]) && secondpart[w] != '-' && secondpart[w] != '+') return -1;
01187                         w++;
01188                 }
01189         }
01190         //printf("%d\n", counter);
01191         if (counter != 0){
01192             strcpy(temp_info->col_type[j], "char");
01193         }else if(counter == 0 && dotcheck > 0) return -1; // found double
01194         else if(counter == 0 && signcheck > 1) return -1; //found too many pluses or minues
01195         else strcpy(temp_info->col_type[j], "int");
01196         strcpy(temp_info->col_value[j], secondpart);
01197         strcpy(temp_info->col_name[j], firstpart);
01198         j++;
01199         split_on_comma = strtok(NULL, ",");
01200     }
01201 
01202     return 0;
01203 }

01206 //Hari's Parser Function /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
01208 
01209 
01217 struct key* check_key(struct key* target_key, int index_col,char* operators, char* type, char* value){
01218 
01219     if(*operators == '='){
01220         if(!strcmp(target_key->value_per_col[index_col],value)) return target_key;
01221         else return NULL;
01222     }
01223     else if(*operators == '>'){
01224         int key_val = atoi(target_key->value_per_col[index_col]);
01225         int check_val = atoi(value);
01226 
01227         if(key_val > check_val) return target_key;
01228         else return NULL;
01229     }
01230     else if(*operators == '<'){
01231         int key_val = atoi(target_key->value_per_col[index_col]);
01232         int check_val = atoi(value);
01233 
01234         if(key_val < check_val)return target_key;
01235         else return NULL;
01236     }
01237     else return NULL;
01238 
01239 }

01242 
01250 int table_query(struct table* target_table, struct temp_table_info* col_info, struct key* key_array[]){
01251     int p;
01252     int i = 0;
01253     int x;
01254     int j;
01255     int index_col = 0;
01256     int l = 0;
01257     int h = 0;
01258     struct key* Arr_Keys[100][100];
01259 
01260     while(Arr_Keys[l][0] != NULL){
01261         h = 0;
01262         while(Arr_Keys[l][h] != NULL){
01263 
01264                 Arr_Keys[l][h] = NULL;
01265                 h++;
01266         }
01267         l++;
01268     }
01269     h=0;
01270     l=0;
01271 
01272     while(col_info->col_name[i][0] != NULL){
01273 
01274         struct key* probe = target_table->head;
01275 
01276         x =0;
01277         while(target_table->col_name[x][0] != NULL){
01278 
01279             if(!strcmp(target_table->col_name[x],col_info->col_name[i])) index_col = x;
01280 
01281             x++;
01282 
01283         }
01284 
01285         j = 0;
01286         while(probe != NULL){
01287 
01288             struct key* target_key;
01289 
01290             target_key = check_key(probe, index_col, col_info->operators[i],col_info->col_type[i],col_info->col_value[i]);
01291 
01292             if(target_key != NULL){
01293                 Arr_Keys[i][j] = target_key;
01294                 j++;
01295             }
01296 
01297             probe = probe->next;
01298 
01299         }
01300 
01301         i++;
01302 
01303     } 
01304 
01305     int w = 0;
01306     int g = 0;
01307     j = 0;
01308     struct key* matches_found[100][100];
01309 
01310     while(matches_found[l][0] != NULL){
01311                 h = 0;
01312                 while(matches_found[l][h] != NULL){
01313 
01314                         matches_found[l][h] = NULL;
01315                         h++;
01316                 }
01317                 l++;
01318         }
01319     l=0;
01320     h=0;
01321 
01322     while(Arr_Keys[0][w] != NULL){
01323         int p = 0;
01324         //only one condition pass all matches found
01325         if(Arr_Keys[1][0] == NULL) {
01326                 while(Arr_Keys[0][j] != NULL){
01327                 key_array[j] = Arr_Keys[0][j];
01328                 j++;
01329                 }
01330                 return 0;
01331         }
01332         while(Arr_Keys[1][p] != NULL){
01333 
01334 
01335                 if(Arr_Keys[0][w] == Arr_Keys[1][p]){
01336 
01337                 matches_found[0][g] = Arr_Keys[1][p];
01338                 g++;
01339 
01340             }
01341             p++;
01342 
01343         }
01344         w++;
01345 
01346     }
01347 
01348     i = 2;
01349     j = 0;
01350     x = 0;
01351     int only_two_pred = 1;
01352     while(Arr_Keys[i][j] != NULL){
01353         int f = 0;
01354         only_two_pred = 0;
01355         while(matches_found[x][f] != NULL){
01356                 p = 0;
01357             f = 0;
01358             while(matches_found[x][f]!=NULL){
01359                 j = 0;
01360                 while(Arr_Keys[i][j]!=NULL){
01361 
01362                         if(Arr_Keys[i][j] == matches_found[x][f]){
01363 
01364                                 matches_found[x+1][p] = matches_found[x][p];
01365                                 p++;
01366 
01367                         }
01368                         j++;
01369 
01370                 }
01371                 f++;
01372 
01373             }
01374             x++;
01375 
01376         }
01377         i++;
01378 
01379     }// after this all the matching keys should be stored in matches_found[x][~];
01380     int q = 0;
01381 
01382     if(only_two_pred){
01383 
01384         while(matches_found[0][q] != NULL){
01385                 key_array[q] = matches_found[0][q];
01386                 q++;
01387 
01388         }
01389         return 0;
01390     }
01391     for(q = 0; q<p; q++){
01392 
01393         key_array[q] = matches_found[x][q];
01394 
01395     }
01396     return 0;
01397 }
